title: Payment methods description
content:
Hi,

when using the built-in Payment Methods feature in Firefox, I find it quite difficult to distinguish between multiple saved cards, especially when they are visually very similar.

In my case, I’m working with several Stripe test cards for development, and they often only differ in subtle details (like the last digits). This makes it easy to pick the wrong card during checkout or testing.

Is there currently a way to add a custom description or label to a saved payment card (for example “Stripe test – successful payment” or “Stripe test – 3D Secure”) that would be shown in the card selection dialog?

If not, is this something that’s planned or already discussed as a potential improvement? From a developer’s perspective, this would be a big usability win.

Thanks in advance!
creator: Morten

title: Synchronization issue
content:
Hello,

I am contacting you because I have a colleague who lost all her bookmarks when migrating her Mac computer. She was syncing with her Professional account. When she migrated and used her account to recover her bookmarks, no data came back. Her laptop was wiped and then reinstalled, so it is not possible to recover any data from it.

Would it be possible for you to find his bookmarks?

Thank you for your help.

Best regards,

Frederic Migaud

title: Meeting Minutes
content:
MINUTES Subject Meeting Minutes - Meeting with the Provincial Administrator, Western Province. HE Alphonse Robert Kaiyun Venue Secretary’s Office, 5th Floor, Morauta House, Waigani. NCD Time 1610 – 1715hrs Date 5 February 2026 In attendance Secretary – Mr. Philip Leo Provincial Administrator – Mr. Alphonse R. Kaiyun Acting Director Technical Support Services – Mr. Orocqo EPH Inerehu Acting Ex. Officer – Mr. Edward Yowe

1. Introduction A courtesy meeting was held between the Administrator of Western Province with Secretary DPLLGA ensued with the following discussions and undertakings

2. The Provincial Administrator visited Secretary with the following issues of concerns which he came to share with Secretary, to gauge his views and if possible gain support for his own initiatives he advanced in the administration of his Province with development plans triggered from the villages, communities, wards, and LLGs to cascade with and harmonize with his DSIP, PSIP, and in overall alignment with the MTDP4. 3. He emphasized the urgent and dire need of such plans to put villages and communities in order with organized services that trigger ordinary village developments, organizing towards improving services, and advancing lives for ordinary population, and improving qualities and standards for the ordinary citizens. 4. He pointed out the missing link or disconnect in planning between the DSIP, PSIP, and the overall NDP and in particular the MTDP4. How could a local village and community in PNG improve its deteriorating services if the current scenario remains uncovered, especially by way of advancing planned interventions and National Government attention and leadership with structured and formatted delivery of basic services to the village and community levels? 5. bold text

title: Unable to Bookmark after a Firefox Update.
content:
I recently updated Firefox on my computer. After that, I can't find my old Bookmarks.

Also I find that I am UNABLE to add any new Bookmark. When I click on the 'Star' in the browser toolbar, there is nothing. Before I used to Get the Add Bookmark tab and a place to SAVE, now there is nothing.

Even after I type in the URL in the address bar, and open up the required page, I am unable to Add it to my Bookmarks.

Please Help!

Gopi Menon [edited email from community support forum]
